stories.title: Radix UI, alternative to tailwind UI

stories.text:
Google Search keeps bothering users by showing unnecessary list of "People Also Search for" message among search results. This is especially annoying when you visit a page and go back to the search results page. Because of this stupid "People Also Search for" message, the search results get shifted down every time you go back to the search results page, so you might click on a wrong link.

This is insane because at the bottom of the search results (right above the page numbers), the same message "People Also Search for" is shown again!!

Google is a huge company and hires the brightest minds. But I keep wondering, who the heck came up with this user-hostile "feature"? This is honestly driving me to use DDG or something else.
stories.title: Ask HN: Who in Google thought it's a good idea to show “people also search for”?

stories.text:
I'm planning to invest $20k.

There are two options in my mind right now.

1. Invest into early-stage SAAS businesses. 2. Hire a team to build my project ideas

Do you have other options?
